description.narrative: Project focuses on promotion of employment/self-employment in small and medium-sized towns.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1. Representatives of local governments (committees on economy) and the staff of the small and medium-sized towns from the selected oblasts of Belarus trained to work in the SRER framework. 2. A complete development and implementation cycle of the SME support and development plans tested at town-forming SOEs. 3. Pilot Industrial Service Platforms (ISP) - incubators - set up using the premises of the restructured SOEs to accommodate small businesses employing the released personnel. 4. Total value (USD) of dedicated loans issued to SMEs established with the support of the project 5. Small and medium-sized enterprises established due to the measures to support entrepreneurship and industrial cooperation in pilot towns. 6. National Subcontracting Centre (NSC) established. 7. Cooperation agreements signed, including businesses from the Russian Federation and the Republic of Kazakhstan. 8. The professional capacity in the field of industrial cooperation and investment attraction improved: experts trained to analyse value chains, to apply international best practices in the social and economic development of small towns and to enhance competitiveness of the selected regions.

comment.narrative: No concept of socially responsible approach to SME development in small and medium-sized towns of Belarus. No business incubators / training centers for small and medium businesses (SME) at the selected town-forming enterprises. Limited conditions for the development of small business and production cooperation in small and medium-sized towns.

1. Trainings on business basics have been held for 200 participants in small and medium-sized towns of Belarus, mainly in Vitebsk and Mogilev oblasts. A number of video films on business basics have been created 2. Presentations and meetings covering the issues of the socially responsible approach have been held with at least 200 participants 3. 5 SME support and development plans for the incubators in pilot towns have been drafted, multilateral discussions of the development plans have been held. Monitoring of the work plans implementation has been ensured 4. The 5th pilot town has been chosen for participation in the project. The rationale is set out in the analytical note. 5. Necessary repairs, equipment and consultations have been provided for 5 incubators/training centers in the pilot towns for hosting small enterprises and individual entrepreneurs 6. At least 20 participants from the national level, business support infrastructure, business associations and other projects partners have studied best practices of organizing effective incubators/training centers. 7. At least 2 people from the national level and projects partners have learned about the implementation of programs for supporting small and medium businesses in the Russian Federation and other CIS countries 8. 2 introductory workshops on establishment of incubators/training centers for SMEs with review of basic approaches to the organization and activities of incubators, issues of SME financing, examples of successful incubators / training centers in Russian regions 9. Dedicated credit funding in the framework of the Development Bank programs has been provided to small and medium-size businesses within the project in the amount of 500 000 USD. 10. At least 7 seminars-consultations have been held for the participants interested in credits for business development or those who had received funds within the programs of the Development Bank of the Republic of Belarus. 11. The development concept for NSC has been approved with amendments. Premises for NSC have been equipped in accordance with the concept. The work for development of industrial cooperation with entities of business support infrastructure in the regions of Belarus is organized. Cooperation with similar structures in the EAEU member states has been established. 12. At least 3 business matchmaking sessions (BMS) for SMEs and large enterprises have been organized, with participation of Russian businesses. 13. At least 15 Belarusian representatives of small and medium-sized business have taken part in business matchmaking sessions in the Russian Federation. 14. Introductory workshop on franchising has been held, handbook on franchising for starting entrepreneurs has been developed and printed, 500 copies.

1. 16 trainings on business basics have been held for 491 participants, of them 309 women and 182 men, in small and medium-sized towns of Belarus, mainly in Vitebsk and Mogilev oblasts. 6 video films on business basics have been created. 2. 7 presentations, roundtables and meetings about the socially responsible approach were held for 371 people, of them 235 women and 136 men. 3. 6 development plans for the pilot business incubators in Baran, Glubokoe, Krichev, Chausy, Gorki and Mstislavl have been developed and approved by the Project Board. 2 mentors– experienced directors of business incubators – were hired to monitor implementation of the approved plans and provide expert support to the heads of the pilot business incubators in the period from October 2018 till December 2019. 4. 2 pilot towns were approved by the Project Board: Gorki and Mstislavl in Mogilev region in 2018. 5. 6 business incubators were established and equipped in the pilot towns of Vitebsk and Mogilev regions in 2018 with the support of the Project, of these: 4 new entrepreneurship support centers were established in Barań, Glubokoe, Gorki, Mstislavl; 2 entrepreneurship support centers in Čavusy and Krichev were enlarged, new coworking and educational spaces equipped. 15 specialists from the pilot business incubators studied best practices of several successful Belarusian business in Misnk region and learned about development of cooperation, enhancement of the regions competitiveness and investment potential on practical examples. 6. 2 study tours were organized for total of 29 participants: to Kazan on 20-24 May 2018 for 15 representatives of the business support infrastructure and project partners (representatives of the pilot towns, regional and district executive committees and other stakeholders); to Novosibirsk on 7-11 October 2018 for 14 representatives of business support infrastructure and state bodies (Ministry of Economy, Ministry of Justice, National Centre of Legislation and Legal Research of the Republic of Belarus, Mogilev Regional Executive Committee, district executive committees of the pilot towns). 7.Study tour to Moscow took place on 9-12 May 2018 for 4 representatives (1 woman and 3 men) of the Ministry of Economy and the Belarussian Fund for Financial Support to Entrepreneurs (BFFSE) to learn about implementation of programs to support small and medium-sized businesses in the Russian Federation. 8.2-day workshop “Best Practices for Successful Business Incubators and Accelerators: Russian Experience” was held on 4 and 5 October 2018 in Minsk. The event introduced Russian and Estonian experience of successful business incubators/accelerators and included practical sessions on design thinking. 6 Russian experts presented their approached to the organization and and activities of incubators, financing of SMEs at different stages of their development. 9. Program “Support of the Regions and Women’s Entrepreneurship” provided funding to small and medium-sized businesses engaged in production and services, registered and operating in the areas of small and medium-sized urban settlements, rural areas of Vitebsk and Mogilev regions for a total amount of 2 730 285 USD for 60 projects with the funds from the Development Bank of the Republic of Belarus. 10. 12 seminars-consultations were held for participants interested in credits for business development or those who had received funds within the programms of the Development Bank of the Republic of Belarus. 408 people (207 women and 201 men) attended the seminars and learned about financing ooprtunities for SMEs, franchising, marketing and women entrepreneurshp. 11. Concept for the development of the National Subcontracting Center has been approved. Following the decisions of the Project Board No. 4 of 08.02.2018 and No.6 of 18.07.2018, server and IP-telephony equipment was selected and purchased, design estimates and construction documentation were developed to modernize the premises of the National Subcontracting Center in the building of the Belarusian Fund for Financial Support to Entrepreneurs located at Serafimovich Str., 11 in Minsk. 12. 3 business matchmaking sessions for SMEs and large enterprises from all regions of Belarus and representatives of Russian business were organized in Minsk, Vitebsk and Mogilev by the project in cooperation with the Belarusian Fund for Financial Support to Entrepreneurs. 10 supply and cooperation agreements were concluded as a result of the exchange. 13. Postponed to Y2019. 14. Practical guidelines on franchising were prepared and published (500 copies). Introductory workshop took place on 12.07.2018 in Minsk for 69 participants from all regions of Belarus to present the guidelines, cover the key issues of franchising and present several franchises, including one from Russia .

1. Summary of the research has been prepared for publication that presents the experience of the project on creating entrepreneurship support centers Small Towns: potential for SME development and attracting investments. 2. Publicity and media campaign held to raise the profile of women entrepreneurship, including at least 80 publications in the national and regional media (TV, radio and printed media) 3. Equipment, consulting services and educational events provided for 6 business incubators in pilot towns according to the approved plans. 4. At least 120 women have participated in 3 two-day business schools learning how to start a business or upscale their current business through upskilling 5. At least 15 representatives took part in exchange of experience and presented activities of the pilot business incubators 6. Conference on entrepreneurship development in small and medium sized towns was held, with the presentation of the project results (not less than 100 participants).

1. Summary of the research has been prepared and printed 500 copies that presents the experience of the project on creating entrepreneurship support centers Small Towns: project experience in SME development” 2. Publicity and media campaign held to raise the profile of women entrepreneurship, including 146 publications in the national and regional media (TV, radio and printed media) as well as Women Business Forum with 350 participants 3. Equipment, consulting services and educational events have been provided for 6 business incubators in pilot towns according to the approved plans. 4. 189 women have participated in 3 two-day business schools learning how to start a business or upscale their current business through upskilling 5. 30 representatives took part in exchange of experience and presented activities of the pilot business incubators 6. Conference on entrepreneurship development in small and medium sized towns was cancelled dut to covid-19 situation. Additional procurement of equipment for the pilot business incubators was provided as approved by the Project Board

1. Materials of the study Small Towns: Potential for SME Development, Integration and Attraction of Investments have been prepared with regard to the 6 pilot towns (with participation of the project partners from the regions) and printed. 2. Materials of the study Small Towns: Potential for SME Development, Integration and Attraction of Investments have been edited and printed 3. Presentations and meetings covering the issues of the socially responsible approach have been held with at least 200 participants. 4. Equipment, repair and consultative support for 6 business incubators in pilot towns have been provided as per their requests. Consulting services and educational events are held according to the approved plans. Monitoring of the plan implementation for each pilot business incubator have been ensured. 5. Dedicated credit funding in the framework of the Development Bank programs has been provided to small and medium sized businesses within the project in the amount at least 500,000 USD. 6. At least 7 seminars-consultations have been held mainly in the pilot towns for the participants interested in credits for business development or those who had received funds within the programms of the Development Bank of the Republic of Belarus. 7. At least 3 business matchmaking sessions (BMS) for SMEs and large enterprises have been organized, with participation of entrepreneurs from the pilot towns of the project. 8. At least 30 Belarusian representatives of small and medium-sized business have taken part in business matchmaking sessions or specialized exhibitions in the Russian Federation. 9. Handbook on methods for cooperation development (on regional clusters) has been prepared and printed. At least 30 people have learned about development of production cooperation and attraction of investments. 10. At least 10 working meetings have been held in the pilot towns to prepare partnership projects. At least 5 projects have been developed to be implemented in the pilot territories. 11. International conference on entrepreneurship development in small and medium sized towns was held, with the presentation of the project results (not less than 100 participants).

3. Presentations and meetings covering the issues of the socially responsible approach have been held for 252 participants from all regions of Belarus. 4. 6 pilot business incubators in Baran, Glubokoe, Krichev, Chausy, Gorki and Mstislavl have been equipped and repaired, consultative support has been provided as per their requests (as of 04/07/2019 for the amount of 91678.31 USD). Consulting services and educational events have been held held according to the approved plans. Monitoring of the plan implementation for each pilot business incubator have been ensured. 5. Dedicated credit funding in the framework of the Development Bank programs has been provided to small and medium sized businesses in small and medium-sized urban settlements, rural areas of Vitebsk and Mogilev regions for a total amount of 676 908 USD. 6. 7 seminars-consultations were held in January-June 2019 for the total of 275 participants (149 women, 127 men) to present financial support programs for SMEs implemented by the Development Bank of the Republic of Belarus and Belarusian Fund for Financial Support to Entrepreneurs. 7. 3 business matchmaking sessions (BMS) for SMEs and large enterprises in ecotourism, cross-border tourism and beauty industry have been organized in Minsk, Glubokoe and Mogilev, with participation of 80 entrepreneurs from the pilot towns of the project. 8. At least 30 Belarusian representatives of small and medium-sized business have taken part in business matchmaking sessions or specialized exhibitions in the Russian Federation. 9. Handbook on regional clusters has been prepared and approved for print.
